file_content.text: Don't know why you're lookin' at me. You're in charge.
You know I enjoy talkin', but I got nothin' to say.
This is the best feeling....
A sky full of stars... a new planet waiting across the galaxy.... It never gets old.
Why do you think I never settled down?
It's a great life.
There's something about cities, all that plasteel and concrete. Weighs too much to ever feel free.
I thought you'd never been off Ord Mantell.
You've done this before?
You know that much about me, Captain?
It's a rare woman who can meet a man and know his whole life just by talking.
You're a rare man to read someone's whole life so fast.
We're criminals for hire, at the mercy of every Hutt in the galaxy. Don't romanticize it.
It's a hard life.
There's no planet you couldn't find work. You're here because you love it.
When I came back to Ord Mantell, I thought that was the end for me.
Thanks for giving me a way off.
I've been wanting to do this a long time.
Kept waiting until I thought we'd be safe, but I don't think we're getting there.
Will you marry me, Captain?
What's wrong with keeping our options open?
Why tie ourselves down?
I got no other options, Captain. After you, any other girl'd be like a child.
Whether you give your vow or not, you've got mine.
Think about it, Captain. Is there anyone else you'd want to spend your life with?
We don't need a wedding for that. Let's keep things how they are.
Why change a good thing?
As long as I know I'm first in your heart, I don't need anything more.
I accept. Be my husband, Corso.
No. You're the one.
You're not going to get the answer you want.
Don't push me.
I'd be honored to have you as my husband.
Yes.
Phew. You don't know how I sweated that one, Captain.
You know, as ship's captain, you're legally empowered by the Republic to perform wedding ceremonies onboard your vessel....
Do you, Corso, take me to be your lawfully wedded bride?
Let's do it.
I do.
I swear to spend my life protecting your body, honoring your spirit and respecting your mind.
My first and last goal of every day will be to bring a smile to your face. Like that one.
I swear to drive you crazy with jealousy, risk your life regularly, make fun of you in public and ensure you never have a boring day again.
Ooh. My turn.
Well, there's an honest vow.
I'll take it, Captain. I love you. I'm honored to have you as my wife.
I accept you as my lawfully wedded husband. To love and cherish until I die in your arms.
I take you as my husband.
May that be a very, very long time away.
I love you, Captain.
Great! We're married. On to the good part!
Time for the honeymoon.
Let's skip to the honeymoon.
Done. Time for the fun part.
You got no shame.
Don't think I'm getting married without a ten-thousand-credit wedding dress and a good caterer!
I'm not in a hurry.
I should have known better.
I'll just consider it a plan for the future, then.
You've got the wrong the idea, Corso.
No.
All right. I knew it was a risk, but I couldn't face the thought of dying and not even having asked.
My whole life, I've wanted what my parents had.
They were best friends, and they were in love, and they died in each other's arms. You're the only one I'd want that with.
Look, Captain, I try not to get sentimental around you, but hear me out.
You're the best thing that ever happened to me. You're my family, as much or more than the one the separatists took.
As long as I live, I'll be here to serve you. And your children after if I last so long.
I hope you're talking about adopting, because I'm not planning on having any babies that aren't yours.
[Flirt] Children?
Good to hear it.
Lot of families got destroyed in this war. Might just be we run across some streetwise orphan who needs a good role model.
Never say never, you know?
Can you seriously picture me with a bunch of rugrats?
Children?
It'd be a beautiful sight.
So just keep my offer in mind.
You want me to have your babies, we'd better get practicing....
[Flirt] Children?
You shut that door, Captain. Don't tease me now.
That sounds like an excellent idea....
I wouldn't want to try any of this without you.
Thank you.
You'll never have to.
You're a good friend, Captain.
You know something I don't?
Children?
All the ladies you get? You really think there's no little captains running around the galaxy?
If they ever catch up with you, keep my offer in mind.
Don't get all sappy on me. You're my crew. That's all I need.
Knock it off.
Then I'm honored to be part of it.
And seriously, keep that children thing in mind. You've got too many talents not to pass them on.
Every kid needs an uncle who's good with a DX-R6 heavy carbine....
We've been through a lot together, Captain.
If it wasn't for you, I'd have walked away from some of it.
But if you gave me a choice between you and the rest of the galaxy, I'd still be here at your side.
I love you.
I didn't think men like you existed. You make me want to be the lady you think I am.
I love you, too.
I know.
I've been waiting for that.
Mmm. Fun.
Mmm, fun? That's all I get?
That's it?
I already told you I'm your man, Captain. I love you. What more do you need to hear?
I love you, too, Corso.
I agree.
I know.
Nice to hear you say it, though.
Frankly, I can think of twenty better ways to pass that time.
Not really.
You can try to hurt me, Captain, but it'd take a lot to get past what I already feel.
I'll break your heart.
Don't love me.
I know I'm not the only man in your world. And you may not be ready to change that.
But I'm the one who's going to be here when you're hurt, when you're old, when you're ready to leave this life.
No matter where you go or who it's with, I'll be waiting right here for you to come home.
Don't fall in love with me, Corso. I'm the wrong girl for you.
I don't want to hurt you.
Too late.
I'll hold you to that.
Just give me time.
One day you'll come back from a mission, and maybe we'll both be gray and wrinkled.
And you're going to see me and realize you can stop running. I've been here all along.
And I'll take you in my arms and ask, "what took you so long?"
The more you go on about this, the more pathetic you sound.
Give it up.
You're never going to find anyone who loves you like I do.
I can wait until you realize that.
I don't know how you live with yourself.
I'm using my own credits to get Danla Zin a flight off Balmorra and away from that pig!
What's the point in having money if you don't use it to help people?
The point is having the fastest ship, the meanest blaster and the shiniest duds in the galaxy!
I use it to help me.
Well, I hope that makes you happy, Captain.
We risk our lives a lot for something we can't take with us when we're gone.
I didn't realize it meant so much to you.
I'm sorry.
Because of us, Danla Zin lost her husband, then you basically sold her to a guy who was drooling over her like a plate of sweetweed.
Ord Mantell's sending us their thanks for the disarm codes.
But that poor woman's life is over.
I won't have you going behind my back to mess up my trades.
Don't you dare.
You don't own me, Captain.
I'll go where you want me and when. But what I do on my own time's my business.
By the way, Ord Mantell says thanks for the disarm codes. They're starting a full recovery. If you even care.
I knew your whole "only in it for the money" thing was just a front!
Thank you, Captain. I couldn't live with myself if we'd left Danla Zin with that pig.
Hardly makes up for killing her husband.
It was all we could do.
She's probably not the first widow we've ever left, Captain. You just got to hope it all evens out, you know?
I lost a lot of money on that deal. I'll be expecting you to make it up to me.
You owe me.
Right, you've got a reputation to maintain.
I figured this way I could skip the moralizing.
I couldn't live with you.
If that's the way to keep you on the straight and narrow, I promise I'll keep doing it.
Governor's office on Ord Mantell says thanks, by the way. With the disarm codes, they've finally got real peace there.
It's hard to say if something like that is worth a life....
Captain, I--no good way to say this without it sounding like bragging.
Got a comm call from Ord Mantell. Governor's office. They've been keeping tabs on what we're doing and....
Captain, they're calling me a Republic hero. "Ord Mantell's most-storied native son."
Ouch. Doesn't speak well of the rest of their people....
You're the best they've got?
Good to know I won't develop a swelled head with you around.
They've got a job for us. Turns out the separatists were Imperial-backed.
You are a hero, Corso. I'm glad someone's acknowledging it.
Congratulations.
It's not like they're building a statue or anything. Actually, they're asking for our help.
Whoop-de-doo. Go drink a toast to yourself.
Who cares?
Actually, they asked me to do something. To help Ord Mantell.
Turns out the separatists were backed by the Empire. They wanted to destabilize the government.
When they were defeated, the Empire attacked outright. Ord drove them off, but they left behind some kind of EMP pulser.
What's that do?
EMP pulser?
It's causing every droid on the planet to malfunction.
They want us to lead their campaign of bloody vengeance?
What do they need now?
Close. They need the disarm codes for the pulser.
I don't remember a lack of explosives on Ord Mantell. Blow it up.
So what?
Apparently, the thing is in orbit somewhere; they haven't been able to get a lock on the signal.
But it's affected every droid, comlink and terminal on the planet. Complete economic shutdown.
How do we help?
Let's get on it.
Thank you, Captain. It'd be nice to give something back to the world that raised me.
They're asking us to go to Balmorra.
Is this a job, or do they think they can get me just by saying something nice about you?
What are they offering?
I can probably swing a payment, if that's what you're asking.
They say it's been months and they're just realizing the extent of the damage. Empire used the same thing on Balmorra.
Don't they have an army or something to deal with this?
Not our concern.
None good enough to take on Balmorra.
Apparently, that's where the pulser was built, and that's where we get the "off switch."
The Empire's got disarm codes stored there, but Ord has no troops with the gear or training to go after them.
They should be like us, learn as they go!
Bah, training!
Does that mean you'll do it?
I don't think most people could survive your kind of school.
They say the codes were stored in a cave the Empire abandoned when Colicoids overran it.
Do we know where on Balmorra?
Point me at them.
The codes were stored in a cave with a bunch of other Imperial weapons.
Evidently, the whole thing got overrun with Colicoids, and the Empire abandoned it.
Should be a quick snatch and grab. As far as "should" takes us....
Do it on your own time. Ord Mantell's nothing to me.
Forget it.
I thought you might like a chance to finish what you started.
They call you a hero there, too, you know.
If you change your mind, I've got a location on the codes. Some Colicoid cave. Shouldn't be anything we can't handle....
I hope I've been some help to you, Captain.
Because you've sure taught me a lot.
I mean, I'd done my share of fighting, but you've got it down to an art.
I mean, I'd done some fighting, but you taught me to go for the jugular. No mercy; that's what wins it.
There's no one I'd rather have at my back.
You're a great fighter.
Thanks, Captain.
I know you don't say that lightly.
I've got no idea what I'm doing. I'm just making it up.
I'm no role model.
Then you think on your feet better than anyone I've met, Captain.
I put my life in your hands every day.
You've got a long way to go before you're as good as me.
Keep practicing.
Believe me, I know. I'm just glad for the chance to learn from the best.
You ever think about getting away from all this, Captain?
The war? The Hutts? All of it?
Ord's at peace now. It'd be a simpler life.
You'd be bored in ten minutes.
Simple isn't better.
Probably so.
I'd miss you.
[Flirt] Don't go.
Well, now, Captain, that's enough to keep me here a long, long time.
Aren't you the one who said we can't turn our backs on the war?
You want to give up?
It's just, after Darmas... kind of feel like hiding my head in the sand.
Nah, that was some other kid you picked up on Ord Mantell.
If that's what you really wanted, you'd stop moaning and just do it!
So go, then.
That's a good point, Captain.
After everything we've done... guess I'm just feeling like hiding my head in the sand.
Viidu always had something to say about that--"gets you shot in the end." Better to face it head-on.
I've been saving this bottle for a long time, Captain.
It's a rare vintage, Ord Mantell 432 BTC. I thought I'd use it when we had reason to celebrate.
But most of our victories aren't really the "raise a toast" type.
You have something you want to celebrate?
What are we toasting?
I hope I do.
We could die tomorrow. Let's make tonight special.
Why wait?
That's what I was hoping.
Is there something you're trying to say?
Get to the point.
I think we've gotten past the wink and nod stage.
You have changed my world. I've never met a woman like you, and I think that's because there are no others. You are amazing.
Captain, it would be my great pleasure if you'd share this bottle with me. Maybe somewhere... private.
We can save the wine for after....
[Flirt] Keep the bottle....
I've never spent the night with a proper Mantellian gentleman before.
I accept.
I hope it's the first of many....
My life'd be about perfect if I could stay right here forever.
I won't let anyone hurt you again.
Just because you like watching my rear, doesn't mean I can't still kick yours.
I don't need to be protected.
There's things a man's got to do. And one is keep his lady safe. Even if she could blast him into component atoms.
The other's this....
You were right. Sometimes it is nice to have someone who'll take care of you.
I like when you say that.
Any time you need me, Captain. Now, tomorrow, or when we're both old and gray.
Don't you have better things to do with your mouth than all this yapping?
You think we're done?
Like this?
Maybe some other time.
I don't think so.
You take the bottle, then, Captain. Save it for when you're ready to celebrate.
You think about it at all? That craziness back on Tatooine?
What makes a person desperate enough to start seeing his fellow men as... meat?
First time we run out of spiceloaf, I'm eating Guss.
Heh. I could see it.
If we ever resort to cannibalism, I've got dibs on Risha.
Heh. I could see it.
Captain! That's horrible! You're going to share, right?
I've got a pretty thick skin, but the idea of being lunch meat still gives me the willies.
It creeps me out.
Seeing those guys makes me wonder if our grasp on sanity's a lot less firm than we think.
People go crazy. End of story.
They were nutjobs.
I guess. But what a story, huh? You think anyone'll believe it?
Anyway, I heard from Jettison. He's recovering.
Took a job in Anchorhead testing HoloNet security.
He went back to Ord. He's looking for a job handling HoloNet security for the governor.
He says he's already patched some major holes in HoloNet security at Port Nowhere.
Glad to know he's okay, you know? One thing to point at and say, "we did some good here."
Yeah, those were people you could feel downright cheerful about killing.
Fighting cannibals is good.
Are you forgetting the hundreds of other people we've saved?
We do lots of good things.
Sure. But there's always something more going on--money, or politics, or something.
It's over. Why start picking apart how you felt about it?
Who cares?
I was just thinking it was nice--no money, no politics, just some righteous killing.
When I was growing up, you know, good was good and bad was bad.
Now, it's all these shades of gray. And even those aren't always true.
Captain. I just got some real good news.
Somebody attempted to access Viidu's old bank accounts from Tatooine!
Why are we excited? Was he trying to buy me a gift or something?
That's good news?
It means somebody's still alive.
Aren't all of Viidu's people dead?
Who could be doing that?
Maybe not!
Who's Viidu?
What are you talking about?
Viidu! You met him. He helped you on Ord Mantell. Guy I worked for before you.
Viidu's crew was like a family to me after mine was killed.
I didn't think any of them survived Skavak and Syreena. I don't know what they'd be doing on Tatooine.
Any idea who's back from the dead?
Got a guess on the survivor?
I'm guessing you see a trip to Tatooine in our future?
Are we paying a visit?
That'd be a real favor, Captain.
Great. Send him a card.
Who cares?
The only one with access to the accounts was our slicer, Twi'lek kid, called himself Jettison. Good guy.
Makes me wonder what got him so desperate he tried to take a loan from a dead man's accounts.
We should go as soon as we can.
Right away.
I said I'd help. Don't make me change my mind.
Quit nagging.
He was a genius with security. We help him when he's in trouble, maybe he could end up working for you....
It'd mean a lot if we could stop on Tatooine so I can make sure the kid's okay.
Where'd the attempt come from? Anchorhead?
Just tell me where.
Of course I'll help.
Thank you, Captain. I won't forget you did this for me.
I was hoping to never go back to Tatooine....
I'll think about it.
From what I can tell, the access attempt came from some village, way off the beaten path. No name or anything.
Really makes me wonder what he's doing out there.
I got to ask you, Captain, why are you doing this?
Before Dodonna, you had no ties to the Republic--there's got to be places you could make credits without taking Imperial fire.
So why do we keep heading straight into the war zones?
The Empire enslaves anyone who looks like me. I can hardly turn down the chance to crush them.
I hate the Empire.
I--I didn't think of it that way.
Gives me a whole new reason to use the big guns.
Just because I don't always pay taxes doesn't mean I don't appreciate the Republic.
I hate the Empire.
Republic's far from perfect. But at least they're trying.
More cash and more fun if you're under live fire.
I'm just in it for the money.
I got the feeling it was maybe more than that.
I thought you were the one who's all "rah, rah, Republic."
You got a problem with that?
I guess I am. I just wasn't sure about you.
When I came home from the brigade with Torchy, my old man told me something that's always stuck with me.
"Minute you fire a weapon, someone's getting hurt. It's your responsibility to make sure the good you do with it outweighs that harm."
When a firefight goes down, who's got time to do that much thinking?
Sounds like a pain.
I try to.
Your father sounds like a good man.
Words to live by.
He was.
Before Skavak took Torchy, I made sure she only fired on separatists. Figured every one I took down was one less family murdered.
Sergeant Boom-Boom, I like to use against the Empire. Buy a Republic world another day of peace.
Makes pulling the trigger that much more meaningful, you know?
When I fire a weapon, all I care is that it hits first.
Forget responsibility.
Only problem with that, is the other guy's thinking just the same.
I don't quite know how to do this with a lady like you, Captain.
Court you, I mean. On Ord Mantell, we had rules about that sort of thing.
With my fiancee, I got permission from her father first, then had a few chaperoned dates between our families....
Since when do you have a fiancee?
Fiancee?
I never saw her after my family died. My whole world blew up and I just... ran.
I wish I'd let her down more gently, but... she wasn't even in the same galaxy as you.
Chaperones? How cute....
That's quaint.
What kind of girl needs her father's permission to date in this day and age?
That's so backwards!
I know it sounds old-fashioned, but there's a reason people do things that way.
You get to know each other with no pressure, keeps you from breaking each other's hearts.
I know it's different here, but... Captain, may I have permission to seek your hand?
I like bad boys. I'd rather see you asking for forgiveness than permission.
[Flirt] I don't like "nice."
I hope I never do anything to you that needs forgiveness, Captain.
If that means roses, love letters and sneaking kisses before we're supposed to, I'm all for it.
Yes.
Well, I'll work on the roses and the love letters.
The rest I think we can manage....
I don't think that would be appropriate.
No.
I can't figure you, Captain.
It's not like this is coming out of nowhere.
Did I read you wrong, or are you just changing your mind?
I'm just not sure what "permission to seek my hand" means. Everything else we're doing, I'm all over.
I was kidding.
I want to get into your heart, Captain.
I don't want to be a conquest. I want to be yours.
Sorry, Corso, the whole puppy-love thing is getting old.
I'm changing my mind.
It's not puppy love, Captain. Not when I've already pledged my life to defend yours.
Don't think that me flirting once in a while is some kind of lifetime commitment.
You read me wrong.
Then I misunderstood. I'm sorry.
But that's the thing about real love. I don't need you to return it for it to make my life mean something.
Nothing worse than realizing your parents were right....
Can't stop thinking about Rona.
My folks always said she'd come to no good in the big city, and there she is... a stooge for some spice smugglers.
I think you got through to her. She won't be there forever.
She can turn it around.
I wish I believed that.
Not anymore. Now she works for me. Just like you.
Now she's my stooge.
Yeah. Just like me.
You told her what you think. The rest is up to her.
It's not your problem.
Her life matters to me, Captain. Hard to trust her with it when I see how she's treated it.
Would you rather she'd been murdered with the rest of them?
As opposed to dying?
Is that the choice? Death or... hawking spice? I wanted something better for Rona.
It's not like I didn't see it coming. "Doctor Hope..." I just didn't wanna think that was really who Rona'd fallen in with.
That's what I get for trying to see the best in folks.
If there's any good in this galaxy, you'll be the one to find it.
Keep believing.
Come on, who's going to cheer me up if you get all mopey?
[Flirt] Stay cheerful.
Captain, I'd do a lot worse than work for some spice dealer if it'd put a smile on your face.
I need you up and shooting, not sitting in your bunk brooding.
Lighten up.
Oh, trust me, I've mastered the brooding shot.
The only thing that keeps people in check is the fear of getting caught. We'll all cheat and lie and kill given the chance.
There is no "best."
All the more reason to resist.
I won't stop giving anyone the benefit of the doubt.
If I trust the wrong guy, maybe I get hurt. But if I'm too scared to help someone who really needs it, who knows how many people will suffer?
Don't you have anything else to talk about?
Stop harping on this!
I'm sorry. Would it impress you more if maybe the Voidwolf had been my long-lost brother?
Pardon me! Maybe I should find out that the Voidwolf is my long-lost brother.
Does that suit your sense of family drama better?
You're not winning any friends, Captain.
I found someone who knows my cousin Rona.
He's a street doctor in Coruscant. Kind of a shady character, but that's who Rona always drifted to.
I think he really can get us to her. But....
There's always a "but...."
Rona loved to walk that line. Every time uncle caught her stealing, it would turn out she was sneaking cash to some mom with two kids on the street.
She's the reason I know breaking the law's got nothing to do with being a good man.
Let's just go to Coruscant and hear her friend out. Ask for cash for the job if you want. I just want to find Rona.
If it gets you to your cousin, I'm in. Just tell me what I'm signing on for.
I'll do whatever you need.
Thank you, Captain. After some of the stuff we've done....
I'm just saying it'd have to be one ugly mission to be worth turning down a chance to see my cousin.
Let's just go to Coruscant and hear the guy out.
You want to play games with your cousin, go ahead. I don't do favors for free.
What's in this for me?
Let's at least hear the guy out. If it's a big job, you can ask for cash for your share.
I just want to find Rona.
If it was you all alone out there, wouldn't you want to know your only family was looking for you?
Finding Rona's good enough for me.
Work, work, work.
There's better ways for a beautful woman to spend her time.
Why don't you let me take you off this ship and show you some fun?
Got something in mind?
Are you asking me out?
I figured, you, me, a bottle of Corellian red. I'm sure we can find a cantina with a back room and... argh. I can't do this.
This doesn't sound like you.
Who are you? Where's Corso?
No. It doesn't. And I'm glad. You know, I sat up all night, thinking: How do I say this? What does she like?
Thought I'd try to be suave, like those guys who hit you up everywhere we land.
But you get that every day. You deserve better. Someone who'll treat you like a lady.
I'm no lady.
That's not what I want.
Being a lady doesn't mean you can't have engine grease on your elbows or a blaster at your hip.
It means you deserve respect. It means you make the decision of who to put up with and how to be treated.
No matter what you say, you'll always be that for me.
Is that a challenge?
[Flirt] No matter what I say?
Don't try to shock me, Captain. I have no doubt you'd succeed.
What about "You, me and the Wookiee--zero-G"?
[Flirt] No matter what I say?
All right. Maybe not that.
Are you volunteering?
Someone like you?
Captain, I'm yours if you'll have me.
I don't know how to play those games and give those gifts and make you laugh like some guys. But I'll be here when all of them are gone.
Don't go picking out curtains for the cockpit quite yet.
It won't be you.
I'm patient.
I know you've been with other men, and maybe there'll be more. But I'll always be here for you.
You're part of my crew, Corso. Anything more would get... awkward.
That's not appropriate.
It doesn't have to.
I know how it goes with the guys you meet. A few nights, a quick goodbye... it won't be like that with me.
I'm your man, Captain, any way you want me.
How do you feel about zero-G?
[Flirt] Any way I want you?
I thought I wanted to be that guy, that fun fling. But I think we've got a chance to be more.
I like you, but... this is all going a little fast for me.
Slow down, Corso.
I'm just telling you what I feel, Captain. I don't expect anything in return.
I've got something to show you. But you have to close your eyes.
I hate surprises.
Fine, but under protest.
Can I open them yet?
Now.
This here's a WESTAR-18 bolt pistol. Antique. Custom-made dallorian-alloy exterior. I've been fixing her up for years.
She's polished 'til she shines and has the firepower to knock you flat. I call her "Sparkles."
I think you'd make a good pair.
I don't want gifts from you.
No.
All I want from you is your trigger finger. Don't bring this up again.
I don't want this.
All right, suit yourself.
I never like asking for favors, Captain. But I think maybe we know each other well enough by now.
I want to look for my cousin Rona. She's all the family I got left, and I think she should know what happened.
Wasn't your whole family killed on Ord Mantell?
You've got a cousin?
Never worry about favors, Corso. You're part of my crew.
You can ask me for anything.
That's a generous offer, Captain. I'll, uh, keep that in mind.
Thank you, Captain.
So call her on the comm. What do I care?
What do you need me for?
I was kind of hoping to introduce the two most influential ladies in my life.
I don't know where Rona is now.
Rona came with me when I left for the brigade, but she jumped ship at the first port. All she ever wanted was to get off Ord Mantell.
I thought maybe we could track her down. You'd like her. She's really the reason I'm here.
I thought you came to chase down Skavak and stayed for the good beer.
You're not here for the fun?
You two will be back together before you can say "a vrblther's vibroblade."
Just tell me when and where.
A vrblth... vrblth... so, not that soon, then?
Rona was kind of our family rebel. We used to have a blast together.
She liked me to run interference so her father never caught her on dates with offworlders.
My kind of girl.
Sounds fun.
Oh, you'd like her, Captain.
I look forward to meeting her.
My kind of girl.
On second thought, maybe I shouldn't introduce you two. Rona's always had a nose for trouble.
I thought you were all about protecting the poor womenfolk....
That's a switch for you.
Well, yeah. My uncle'd have given her a walloping if he'd known the kind of men she was with.
I remember one time, uncle came looking for Rona while she was on the shuttle pod with some Agamarian pirate. I was about twelve.
I didn't know how else to distract uncle, so I started a fight. Got the whole ship confiscated.
I never did find out how Rona got out of city jail....
Save the cute anecdotes for the family reunion.
I don't want to hear this.
Only if we can track her down.
I'll put it on the list. That's all you're getting.
I'll think about it.
If it was the other way, Rona'd make sure I found my friend to tell him his whole family had died.
But you do what you need to, Captain.
Boy, Captain, life with you is almost enough to get me missing the good old days.
Ah, for Ord Mantell. Where separatists were bad and guns were good, and we could just run in shooting.
I'm not noticing a drop off in our rate of running in and shooting....
Has something changed?
Yeah, we just have to do so much thinking first.
I could be persuaded into a little drunken gunplay...
[Flirt] We can still do that.
I'm not drunk.
Are you drunk?
You sound weird.
Just tipsy. I could still bullseye an Imperial soldier at a thousand paces.
Why don't we have more fun on this ship?
Is this going to be some maudlin diatribe about the big bad galaxy?
Let's not do this again.
Maudlin! When have I ever been maudlin?
I was talking about finding a way to have some fun on this ship!
Back home, when we needed a laugh, we used to run the rontos in circles, then see if they could charge us without falling over.
What about that time Guss stuck his lightsaber in the power socket?
We have lots of fun!
What about that time Risha gave Bowdaar a bath?
We have lots of fun!
That was good fun.
What about watching Risha yell at me? Isn't that fun?
We have lots of fun!
Yeah, that's always good for a laugh....
Your idea of fun needs some serious updating.
Is that the best you can do?
Well, I don't hear you coming up with anything.
Hey... maybe we could paint Akaavi's helmet pink. We'd learn how to curse in Mando'a....
Hey, maybe we could shave Bowdaar while he's sleeping. Bet he's not nearly as impressive without all that hair.
Hey, maybe we could swap out Guss's lightsaber for a glowrod. You think he'd notice?
Hey, maybe we swap out Risha's special princess crown. How purple do you think she'd turn if she found a plasteel one in its place?
What do you say? Just give me the word.
You got any suggestions that don't involve farm animals?
[Flirt] Any better ideas?
I've got a few... but they might take a while to explain.
Care to let me show you?
I'm sorry. I shouldn't have said that.
You afraid I'm going to turn you down?
[Flirt] Why not?
I've got a few ideas of my own I could show you.
[Flirt] Yes, you should.
It's not right, me propositioning you like some... Hutt's dancer. You deserve better.
You deserve a man you can let your guard down with. Someone who'll take care of you for a change.
I wonder where I can find one....
True....
I'm not going to presume anything, Captain.
But I'd like you to consider letting me show you I can be something more.
The day I need someone to take care of me, I'm selling the ship and taking up knitting.
I can take care of myself.
You're the strongest woman I ever met, the strongest person, period....
I'd fight for you or with you or at any command you give. I just think you deserve more.
Don't push your luck.
Let's stop talking about this.
Understood, Captain. I won't say anything again until we're both ready.
Don't ruin this, Corso. You're in my crew. That's all.
You're right. You shouldn't.
Yeah, I know that, Captain.
Sometimes it's just hard not to show what I feel.
Good night, Corso....
Sleep it off.
Maybe I should go lie down....
So, how'd you end up out here, Captain?
Was there ever a time you wanted something more... normal?
A husband? Kids? Someone to take care of you?
I take care of myself. Always have. Always will.
Not a chance.
I'm not trying to start anything, Captain. Just thinking about a guy I met in the brigade. A merc. Fought for the Republic for twenty years.
A family? A steady job somewhere you didn't need a blaster in-hand?
I've got my freedom, my ship and my gun. What more is there?
Not a chance.
Are you happy here, or would you rather be back raising rontos?
Is that what you want?
I've just been thinking about a guy I met in the brigade. Mercenary. He'd been fighting for the Republic for twenty years.
I'm just in this until I can retire rich.
I won't be here forever.
I don't know. It's hard to go back.
I met a mercenary on Clak'dor Seven, when I was in the brigade. He'd spent twenty years fighting for the Republic.
I was sixteen, fresh off the ship. This guy gave me my first blaster.
I thought you country boys grow up shooting.
Your first blaster?
What kind of moron gives a blaster to some kid on a community service project?
What a nut!
It was a war zone. I was the crazy one, going unarmed. I was just squeamish....
I mean, sure, I'd handled a hunting rifle, but never anything aimed at people.
This guy told me, "Gun's just a tool. You use it to destroy, or you use it to protect against those who would destroy you."
Guess you didn't figure that one out on your own?
This was news to you?
So it's not exactly astrophysics, but it made sense to me. You can't protect anything if you're afraid to be out there shooting.
And you took it to heart.
I guess it meant a lot to you.
Made me think different about guns. You can't protect the people you love if you're afraid to get your hands dirty.
I brought Torchy home, and my parents made me lock her up. Told me not to "wish away peace."
I didn't have her when the separatists came.
If you're in my crew, you shoot when I tell you.
You use it when I say.
You'll know the first time I stop being okay with that.
I don't need to hear every time you remember some cute story from your past.
Start a diary!
Hmph. Maybe Risha's better company....
So, how about that war, huh, Captain?
Feels good to have a real victory in hand. Treaty of Coruscant was a stitch in a gut wound.
It's a relief to have it out in the open. Why dicker over a treaty with a bunch of murdering slavers?
The Empire's making it real tough to pretend it's not happening.
You think the Republic'll stop hiding behind the Treaty of Coruscant and admit they want the Empire wiped out?
It doesn't sit right negotiating with people who want every man, woman and kid dead.
You practicing your speech for office?
I didn't realize you cared..
You trying to tell me you don't think about it? I do.
The scum are going down!
You got guts, Captain. I hope you don't mind if I come along to take a few hits for you.
Then me and Sergeant Boom-Boom'll be right there with you, Captain.
What does it matter how they kill each other, as long as there's credits to be made?
I don't care about the war.
And you call me naive.... There's no credits to be made in an Imperial slave collar.
I joined the Peace Brigade when I was fourteen. I know what a world looks like when the Empire's done with it.
What's that? A bunch of do-gooders?
The Peace Brigade?
The way Skavak talked, I thought you were fresh off the farm.
I didn't know you'd traveled.
Me and Skavak weren't as close as he thought.
The brigade's a relief organization. Go into worlds abandoned by the Treaty of Coruscant, help people displaced by the Empire.
I was a kid looking for an adventure. After two months... let's just say there are no kids in war zones.
I don't need to hear about your heartwarming life saving puppies and orphans.
Spare me.
It's a lot easier to look down on orphans when they're not staring back up at you, Captain.
All I'm saying is, there's a right side and a wrong side in this war. Not much between.
It's getting more painful to talk to you than be ignored by you.
What are you looking for that I haven't offered?
Did you just want something more exotic? What did that prissy Voss have that I don't?
Lokir-Ka made me happy in a way you can never understand.
I love him.
You're right. I'll never understand.
Tell me one thing that sleazy Balmorran could do for you that I can't?
Numen Brock made me laugh. I miss him every day.
I love him.
That's all it takes? I devote my life to you and you're looking for a cheap punch line?
Do I mean anything to you?
I care about you, Corso. I didn't mean to upset you.
I'm sorry.
Didn't mean to upset me?
Where you're from, do people not usually get upset when the love of their life runs off with other men?
How am I supposed to watch you hurting people without it killing what I feel about you?
We have something special, Captain. Don't destroy it.
I think we were doing better when we were just crew mates.
Let's just be friends.
Uh-uh. I'm not letting you out of it that easily.
I'm going to find a way to make you see me, Captain.
And when you do, you'll never look at another man.
And when you do, maybe you can finally stop having to show the world how tough you are.
If you're so devoted, then shut up and deal with it.
Stop whining.
I'm willing to wait for you, Captain.
But I'm not your punching bag.
Oh? Is the lord on high deigning to speak with me?
You've gotten real full of yourself lately, Captain.
Not much fun working under you.
If you've got a problem with me, Corso, tell it straight.
What are you talking about?
You're changing, Captain.
I didn't realize you were feeling that way.
I'm sorry.
Maybe you ought to pay more attention.
I know the "biggest jerk in the galaxy" thing is just an act, but you should watch it.
Spend all your time convincing people it's true, no one'll care if there was once something more.
You're in my crew, on my ship. You don't talk to me that way.
Shut up!
I guess you like it better when I don't talk at all.
I don't know what you're doing, Captain. Seems like you're trying to hurt me and just hurting yourself.
You deserve better than this life, these men....
Let me in, Captain. Let me be the one you lean on to deal with all this ugliness.
All I'm looking for is a good time.
I don't need you.
Is breaking a man's heart a good time?
I want more, Captain. And I think you deserve more.
But you'll have to make that decision on your own.
You're so much better to me than I deserve.
Thank you.
You deserve the galaxy, Captain.
Why do you work so hard to make people think less of you?
It takes more than a working knowledge of ronto husbandry to keep me happy.
You couldn't take it.
If that's still all you think of me, you haven't been paying attention.
I can't do it, Captain.
I saw something in you, but I guess you don't see it in yourself.
If I tried to be the man you want--some hardened killer who doesn't care what happens to you--we'd both end up hating me.
What are you saying?
Are you dumping me?
I love you, Captain, but I can't do this halfway.
I'm sorry, Corso. I never meant to hurt you.
No. We can make this work.
You're not stupid, Captain. And neither am I.
I don't think either of us believes that.
Can't possibly go worse than whining at me.
I hate you already.
I'd spend my life hunting down any man who tried to hurt you, Captain.
But there's nothing I can do when the one hurting you is yourself.
I really thought you'd be different, Captain.
I had this whole dream. About the heart of gold I'd find under that prickly shell.
But I guess the surface is all you've got.
Saving people from the Empire isn't enough for you?
I've got a heart of gold.
Oh, I suppose we do some good, but... I don't know why you go out of your way to make it feel dirty.
You're my friend, Corso. I want you to be happy.
Let's make things better.
Come on! It's not hard to make me happy. I like to be happy. Just not when you're hurting people.
I mean, I understand being ruthless. But I could never be cruel just for fun.
I'm not asking you to go soft, just... meet me halfway, okay?
No one wants to hear your whining.
Keep it to yourself.
I'm well aware what you think of me.
I was wrong about you, Captain.
I thought coming with you, I'd have a chance to make friends, have fun and leave the galaxy a better place.
I never figured the only good I'd get to do was offsetting your petty evils.
When I get me some petty evil, I'm not letting you offset it.
Don't even try it.
This isn't a joke, Captain!
We can work this out. Just tell me how you want me to change.
It's not that bad.
I'm not falling for that line again, Captain.
I run this ship! You don't get to decide if you don't like how I do it.
You work for me!
I'm not your slave.
From now on, I'm just here to see what you're messing up and use my own time to put it right.
And don't worry. You won't hear from me again. Helping you is obviously a lost cause.
Let me get back to you later, Captain.
When you've got a minute, Captain, I've got something on my mind.
When we're back on board, I'd like a word with you, Captain.
All right.
Don't worry about me.
You got it.
Can't we ever go to a nice world?
Right behind you, Captain.
You've got a plan for making us even richer, right?
Lead on....
I didn't think it was possible for this job to get more complicated.
What's our play, Captain?
You ever get the feeling we're in over our heads?
You've got an interesting idea of fun.
Anything you want, Captain.
I'll say one thing, traveling with you is never dull....
Full speed ahead.
You got guts, Captain. I hope you don't mind if I come along to take a few hits for you.
